device.name: i2c_link_v1
device.documentation: The i2c_link_v1 class implements the functionality of an I2C bus, to which several I2C devices can connect. Connecting I2C devices should implement the <iface>i2c_master</iface> or <iface>i2c_slave</iface> interface.
device.limitations:
• Link distribution is not yet implemented.
  • The bus may behave incorrectly if a device is removed while it is involved in a data transmission. Currently, this is handled in a way that prevents certain deadlocks, and it is unclear whether real I2C hardware does this.
  • General Call addressing (slave addr = 0b00000000)
  • START byte (slave addr = 0b00000001)
  • 10-bit addressing (slave addr = 0b11110xxx)
  • It is currently not supported to mix i2c_link_v2 and i2c_link_v1 when the former has attached i2c_slave devices and the master is i2c_master. These slaves will not be exposed to the i2c_link_v1 upon connection of the i2c_link_v2.
